title: Stuart Wheeler: ‘I worry that Boris will allow a very soft Brexit’
text:
If Nigel Farage is the “Godfather of Brexit”, the man whose campaigning over the past 20 years forced the Tories to hold the in-out EU referendum, then City businessman Stuart Wheeler should be called the “Banker of Brexit”.

For spread-betting multi-millionnaire Wheeler was donating vast sums of his own money to the Conservative Party – and, latterly, Ukip and the Vote Leave campaign – at a time when leaving the European Union was very much a fringe political issue.

Winning Against the Odds, his new memoir published this week, lays bare how the entrepreneur went about spending the fortune he made from his IG Index business, the pioneering financial spread betting company he set up in the mid-1970s,...
description: If Nigel Farage is the “Godfather of Brexit”, the man whose campaigning over the past 20 years forced the Tories to hold the in-out EU referendum, then City businessman Stuart Wheeler should be called the “Banker of Brexit”.
